subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Kikkan Randall became the first United States woman and the second American to win a World Cup cross-country race when she defeated the world sprint champion Astrid Jacobsen of Norway in the final meters of a 1.2-kilometer freestyle race in Demino, Russia.Randall is the first American to win a World Cup cross-country race since Bill Koch in 1983. She finished in 2:48.7 — seven-tenths of a second ahead of Jacobsen.
